title: What is the practice of "Estasi filosofica" and how can one achieve it through physical and mental immobilization?
first_phrase: In the previous paragraphs, the author discusses the practice of immobilizing the body in a comfortable position and letting the mind wander without any effort. In this last part, the author mentions a document titled "The Practice of Philosophical Ecstasy" by Tommaso Campa published in 1854. According to the document, one should select a quiet and dark place and detach oneself from any kind of passion while closing their eyes. This would induce a sense of standing still and being present in the moment.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the practice of philosophical ecstasy requires a quiet and secluded place where the body and mind are devoid of passions and thoughts. As mentioned in the writings of Tommaso Campa, the body must be comfortable, free from pain and discomfort, while the mind must be devoid of any form of emotion, memory, or present thoughts. These guidelines can help anyone interested in experiencing philosophical ecstasy to achieve the necessary state of mind and body. Please note that this material is protected by copyright laws.
